1.verse: Paul, Silas  ( A ) and Timothy, ( B )

2.verse: Grace and peace to you from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ. ( D )

3.verse: We ought always to thank God for you, ( E ) brothers and sisters,  and rightly so, because your faith is growing more and more, and the love all of you have for one another is increasing. ( F )

4.verse: Therefore, among God’s churches we boast ( G ) about your perseverance and faith ( H ) in all the persecutions and trials you are enduring. ( I )

5.verse: All this is evidence ( J ) that God’s judgment is right, and as a result you will be counted worthy ( K ) of the kingdom of God, for which you are suffering.

6.verse: God is just: ( L ) He will pay back trouble to those who trouble you ( M )

7.verse: and give relief to you who are troubled, and to us as well. This will happen when the Lord Jesus is revealed from heaven ( N ) in blazing fire ( O ) with his powerful angels. ( P )

8.verse: He will punish ( Q ) those who do not know God ( R ) and do not obey the gospel of our Lord Jesus. ( S )

9.verse: They will be punished with everlasting destruction ( T ) and shut out from the presence of the Lord ( U ) and from the glory of his might ( V )

10.verse: on the day ( W ) he comes to be glorified ( X ) in his holy people and to be marveled at among all those who have believed. This includes you, because you believed our testimony to you. ( Y )

11.verse: With this in mind, we constantly pray for you, ( Z ) that our God may make you worthy ( AA ) of his calling, ( AB ) and that by his power he may bring to fruition your every desire for goodness ( AC ) and your every deed prompted by faith. ( AD )

12.verse: We pray this so that the name of our Lord Jesus may be glorified in you, ( AE ) and you in him, according to the grace of our God and the Lord Jesus Christ.

1.verse: Concerning the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ ( A ) and our being gathered to him, ( B ) we ask you, brothers and sisters,

2.verse: not to become easily unsettled or alarmed by the teaching allegedly from us—whether by a prophecy or by word of mouth or by letter ( C ) —asserting that the day of the Lord ( D ) has already come. ( E )

3.verse: Don’t let anyone deceive you ( F ) in any way, for that day will not come until the rebellion ( G ) occurs and the man of lawlessness  is revealed, ( H ) the man doomed to destruction.

4.verse: He will oppose and will exalt himself over everything that is called God ( I ) or is worshiped, so that he sets himself up in God’s temple, proclaiming himself to be God. ( J )

5.verse: Don’t you remember that when I was with you I used to tell you these things? ( K )

6.verse: And now you know what is holding him back, ( L ) so that he may be revealed at the proper time.

7.verse: For the secret power of lawlessness is already at work; but the one who now holds it back ( M ) will continue to do so till he is taken out of the way.

8.verse: And then the lawless one will be revealed, ( N ) whom the Lord Jesus will overthrow with the breath of his mouth ( O ) and destroy by the splendor of his coming. ( P )

9.verse: The coming of the lawless one will be in accordance with how Satan ( Q ) works. He will use all sorts of displays of power through signs and wonders ( R ) that serve the lie,

10.verse: and all the ways that wickedness deceives those who are perishing. ( S ) They perish because they refused to love the truth and so be saved. ( T )

11.verse: For this reason God sends them ( U ) a powerful delusion ( V ) so that they will believe the lie ( W )

12.verse: and so that all will be condemned who have not believed the truth but have delighted in wickedness. ( X )

13.verse: But we ought always to thank God for you, ( Y ) brothers and sisters loved by the Lord, because God chose you as firstfruits  ( Z ) to be saved ( AA ) through the sanctifying work of the Spirit ( AB ) and through belief in the truth.

14.verse: He called you ( AC ) to this through our gospel, ( AD ) that you might share in the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ.

15.verse: So then, brothers and sisters, stand firm ( AE ) and hold fast to the teachings  we passed on to you, ( AF ) whether by word of mouth or by letter.

16.verse: May our Lord Jesus Christ himself and God our Father, ( AG ) who loved us ( AH ) and by his grace gave us eternal encouragement and good hope,

17.verse: encourage ( AI ) your hearts and strengthen ( AJ ) you in every good deed and word.

1.verse: As for other matters, brothers and sisters, ( A ) pray for us ( B ) that the message of the Lord ( C ) may spread rapidly and be honored, just as it was with you. ( D )

2.verse: And pray that we may be delivered from wicked and evil people, ( E ) for not everyone has faith.

3.verse: But the Lord is faithful, ( F ) and he will strengthen you and protect you from the evil one. ( G )

4.verse: We have confidence ( H ) in the Lord that you are doing and will continue to do the things we command.

5.verse: May the Lord direct your hearts ( I ) into God’s love and Christ’s perseverance.

6.verse: In the name of the Lord Jesus Christ, ( J ) we command you, brothers and sisters, to keep away from ( K ) every believer who is idle and disruptive ( L ) and does not live according to the teaching  you received from us. ( M )

7.verse: For you yourselves know how you ought to follow our example. ( N ) We were not idle when we were with you,

8.verse: nor did we eat anyone’s food without paying for it. On the contrary, we worked ( O ) night and day, laboring and toiling so that we would not be a burden to any of you.

9.verse: We did this, not because we do not have the right to such help, ( P ) but in order to offer ourselves as a model for you to imitate. ( Q )

10.verse: For even when we were with you, ( R ) we gave you this rule: “The one who is unwilling to work ( S ) shall not eat.”

11.verse: We hear that some among you are idle and disruptive. They are not busy; they are busybodies. ( T )

12.verse: Such people we command and urge in the Lord Jesus Christ ( U ) to settle down and earn the food they eat. ( V )

13.verse: And as for you, brothers and sisters, never tire of doing what is good. ( W )

14.verse: Take special note of anyone who does not obey our instruction in this letter. Do not associate with them, ( X ) in order that they may feel ashamed. ( Y )

15.verse: Yet do not regard them as an enemy, but warn them as you would a fellow believer. ( Z )

16.verse: Now may the Lord of peace ( AA ) himself give you peace at all times and in every way. The Lord be with all of you. ( AB )

17.verse: I, Paul, write this greeting in my own hand, ( AC ) which is the distinguishing mark in all my letters. This is how I write.

18.verse: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. ( AD )
